Works in current builds.  A fix was released last week for similiar issues. 
Please reopen if you have a specific senerio that recreates this issue.  I
simply created a ejb project excepting the defaults (create client and add to
ear = true).  Everything went fine (other than some server target stack dumps
but there is already a defect opened for that.

Naci, no one locally can reproduce so WorksForMe'n this again...can you please 
give detailed steps to reproduce on the 6.30 build(all selections made in the 
creation wizard, multi modules/ project or not, etc) or if you are doing this 
via code send me the code os i can create  test case to reproduce.

Derek, sorry for the ping-pong :-), I tried it with 0630 ... Still the same.


This exactly what I do and I had it happening again.

1) I start with a blank installation. 
2) Close the welcome page
3) Switch to Java perspective
4) Use Other...>New>Enterprise JavaBean
5) Click on the (new..) button to create new EJB Project
6) Enter MyEjbProject
7) Choose WAS6.0 Generic Server (Set default VM to IBM JVM that comes with was)
8) Click advanced
9) Check ear/client jar
10) Click finish

This is not a blocker as the work around is simply to use the ejb project 
wizard before creating a bean (which is what most users do).  Seeing as the 
basic ejb project creation works outside of your wizard i'm thinking your 
implementation may be wrong (or missing something).  We will dig into it.

John sending your way as I'm out the next two days....give it a look, i was 
unable to reproduce as i was lackign xdoclet....regualr ejb creation works 
fine, must be somethign w/ the way this is nested/set up.  Thanks

causedBy.message: Path for project must have only one segment.
